definitions_glossary.planck_entropy: S_P = k_B = 1.380649 × 10⁻²³ J/K, the natural unit of entropy
definitions_glossary.boltzmann_constant: k_B, links temperature to energy; S_P = k_B by definition
definitions_glossary.nat: Natural unit of information = ln(e) = 1; entropy S = 1 nat when W = e microstates
definitions_glossary.bit: Binary unit of information = ln(2); 1 nat ≈ 1.443 bits
definitions_glossary.boltzmann_formula: S = k_B·ln(W), entropy from number of microstates W
definitions_glossary.bekenstein_hawking_entropy: S_BH = k_B·A/(4ℓ_P²), black hole entropy proportional to area
definitions_glossary.bekenstein_bound: S ≤ 2πk_B·RE/(ℏc), maximum entropy in spherical region
definitions_glossary.holographic_bound: S ≤ k_B·A/(4ℓ_P²), maximum entropy bounded by surface area

exact_value_details.note: S_P = k_B exactly - same constant, no derivation needed

information_equivalence.nat: 1 k_B = 1 nat of information (natural logarithm base)

definition.@value: The fundamental unit of entropy S_P = k_B = 1.380649 × 10⁻²³ J/K (exact), which is simply the Boltzmann constant itself

prerequisites.title: Planck Area
prerequisites.reason: Black hole entropy uses A_P = ℓ_P²

related.relationship: Holographic bound uses S_P as entropy unit

learning_objectives: Understand that Planck entropy S_P = k_B exactly
Connect physical entropy to information content
Recognize S_P is exact since 2019 SI redefinition
common_errors: Thinking S_P is derived from other Planck units (it's just k_B)
Missing that k_B is now exact by definition
physics_insights: S_P = k_B is exact, like L_P = ℏ - both are just fundamental constants
Black hole entropy formula: 4 Planck areas per bit of information
1 nat ≈ 1.44 bits; information and entropy are deeply connected
